DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to assess the efficacy of high-oleic canola oil and a high-oleic canola/flaxseed oil blend as compared to a typical Western diet on plasma lipids, fatty acid profiles, and risk factors associated with cardiovascular disease in hypercholesterolemic patients. Furthermore, the metabolism of dietary oleic acid and alpha-linolenic acid contained in high-oleic canola oil and flaxseed oil will be investigated.
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy of High-oleic Canola and Flaxseed Oils for Hypercholesterolemia and Cardiovascular Disease Risk Factors
DOC.criteria: Fasting serum LDLCholesterol >3.0 mmol/L Body mass index (BMI) between 2236 kg/m2 smoking use of lipid lowering therapy documented cardiovascular/atherosclerotic disease inflammatory disease diabetes uncontrolled hypertension kidney disease other systemic diseases cancer chronic alcohol consumption (> 2 servings/day) excessive exercise expenditure (> 4000 kcal/week)
